title: (x) More Magazine masthead and cover typeface - Gotham {George}
content:
The logo for MORE magazine ( [www.more.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231061543/http:/www.more.com/ "www.more.com")). Please help me ID what typeface this is. It looks like Gill Sans, but it isn't quite the same.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231061543/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201.png) | 4.46 KB |
author: liang zhang

comments.content:
The typeface is most certainly Gotham Medium from Hoefler & Frere Jones.

[http://www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/testdriver/gotham\_medium.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231061543/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/testdriver/gotham_medium.html "http://www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/testdriver/gotham\_medium.html")
I work at more.com. What did you need to know the type face for? The above font is correct.
Thank you both for identifing the Typeface. This is a school project, for my editorial design class. We are asked to design a spread, while imitating a style and grid of a certain magazine.
Gotham seems to be the "it" font for magazines these days - from House Beautiful to Glamour to Martha Stewart to you name it.
Good luck with the project. Where are you located? Be sure to look up meredith.com when you are looking for jobs.
What are the gorgeous display faces MORE has been using in their features lately?
